intro: Securinega fluggeoides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height, featuring small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds and can cause skin irritation. Securinega fluggeoides is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
